title: Robert Pattinson is going for the best actor Oscar next year
text:
Go RPatz! (Picture: WireImage)

Robert Pattinson will compete in the lead actor category at the Oscars in 2020 for his role in The Lighthouse.

Robert will be submitted by film distributor A24 the lead actor category, while his co-star Willem Dafoe will be in the supporting actor field, Variety reports.

The Lighthouse, which opens October 18, has attracted plenty of praise on the festival circuit since premiering at Cannes in May, where writer-director Robert Eggers won an International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) Prize.

In the film Robert and Willem play two lighthouse keepers isolated on a small island who begin to grapple with their sanity.

The 33-year-old actor has never previously been nominated for an Oscar but has taken on more serious roles since he shot to fame as Edward in the famous Twilight series, after playing Cedric Diggory in Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire when he was 18.

Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson in The Lighthouse (Picture: A24)

Robert has since worked with such directors as David Cronenberg, the Safdie brothers and Christopher Nolan, and will be the latest to don the mask and cape to play Batman.

The London lad’s choices and performances have drawn recognition, particularly for his turn in Good Time.

In a review for The Lighthouse one scene was referred to as ‘the most ferocious acting of Pattinson’s career.’

Meanwhile, Willem’s nomination would be his third consecutive nomination after last year’s At Eternity’s Gate and 2017’s The Florida Project.

He was also previously nominated for Platoon and Shadow of the Vampire.

While the film is very much a two-hander, Robert has more screen time and his character serves as the audience’s point of view.

At a recent Q&A, Robert said about working working with Willem that the film was ‘like doing a one-act play with a genius.’

He added, ‘I knew he was going to bring something crazy. I knew he would have so much anarchic energy. I was very intimidated but it’s always helpful when the part calls for you to be intimidated by somebody.’

The Lighthouse is released in cinemas from October 18.
